duties_responsibilities.duty: Design enclosures for electronic devices and mechanical assemblies to rigidly attach electronic equipment in high vibration environment.
Create cable routing paths and mounting solutions for cables on a vehicle.
Select off the shelf hardware components to use in assemblies and create 2D drawings based on 3D models.
Prototype and assemble hardware to support project development and support environmental testing.
Collaborate with dispersed team, design novel mechanical assemblies, and work in a matrix environment.
Collaboration with dispersed team, suggesting and implementing technical solutions, giving timelines for project deliverables, and selecting components and materials.
Work with internal and external contacts, such as Test Engineer, Solution Architect, Operations Engineer, Embedded System Engineer, Manufacturers, machine shops, and test labs.
Provide root cause analysis of mechanical failures.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent. Ability to come to the office in Santa Clara for 1-2 days in a week. Ability to create complex and detailed mechanical models in mechanical CAD. Experience with different fabrication processes and ability to decide which process to use for designs.
Experience with Thermal Analysis, Machining and welding experience, Experience creating cable drawings, and Experience with designing for automotive industry.

Experience with SolidWorks CAD, Experience working as a Mechanical Engineer for 3-5 years, Sheet metal design, Weldment design, Design for scaling / manufacturability, Working with machine shops / 3D Printing / 3D Scanning.
3D modelling, Assembly of complex mechanical systems, Basic electrical knowledge.
